content:
What a great opportunity! A dialect coaching workshop can be incredibly valuable in helping you refine your French accent and pronunciation for your role as Éponine. Preparing for the workshop will ensure you make the most of your time and get the most out of the experience. Here are some tips to help you prepare:

**Before the workshop:**

1. **Review your research**: Refresh your knowledge of the French accent and pronunciation you've been working on. Review your notes, listen to recordings, and practice speaking to get a sense of where you are in your journey.
2. **Identify your goals**: Think about what you want to achieve from the workshop. Do you want to focus on a specific aspect of the French accent, such as the "r" sound or vowel pronunciation? Make a list of your goals to discuss with the dialect coach.
3. **Prepare questions**: Write down questions or areas of concern you have about your French accent and pronunciation. This will help you make the most of your time with the dialect coach.
4. **Practice your script**: Bring a copy of your script or a scene from Les Misérables to work on during the workshop. This will give the dialect coach a better understanding of your role and help you apply the techniques you learn.

**During the workshop:**

1. **Be open-minded**: Be prepared to try new techniques and exercises that may feel uncomfortable at first. Remember, the goal is to improve your French accent and pronunciation.
2. **Take notes**: Take notes on any feedback, tips, or exercises the dialect coach provides. This will help you remember what you learned and practice consistently.
3. **Ask questions**: Don't hesitate to ask questions or seek clarification on any points you're unsure about.
4. **Participate actively**: Engage fully in the workshop, participating in exercises and activities. This is your chance to get personalized feedback and guidance.

**After the workshop:**

1. **Review and reflect**: Review your notes and reflect on what you learned during the workshop. Identify areas where you need more practice or review.
2. **Practice consistently**: Make a plan to practice regularly, using the techniques and exercises you learned during the workshop.
3. **Follow up**: Consider following up with the dialect coach or a language exchange partner to continue working on your French accent and pronunciation.

By preparing for the workshop, you'll be able to make the most of your time and get the most out of the experience. Remember to stay open-minded, take notes, and practice consistently to reinforce what you learn. Good luck, and I hope you have a fantastic time at the workshop!
